place.name: TURNERS PUDDLE
place.gazetteerText: TURNERS-PUDDLE, a parish in Wareham district, Dorset; 4¾ miles NNW of Wool r. station, and 7¼ NW by W of Wareham. Post town, Dorchester. Acres, 1,983. Real property, £656. Pop., 111. Houses, 19. The manor belongs to J. Frampton, Esq. The living is a rectory, united with Affpuddle, in the diocese of Salisbury. Value, £210 Patron, H. Frampton, Esq. The church is tolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
